intro: Fritschiantha sylvatica var. coccinea, commonly known as the red-flowered sylvatic fritschiantha, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its vibrant crimson flowers, which are typically tubular and attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral morphology and ecological role within its native habitat.
